Poem Title: OR IN TWO VOLUMES IN ART BOARDS
OR IN TWO VOLUMES IN ART BOARDS
THE PELICAN CHORUS AND OTHER VERSES
line: THE PELICAN CHORUS AND OTHER VERSES
A carrion crow sat on an oak,
Fol de riddle, lol de riddle, hi ding do,
Watching a tailor shape his cloak;
bring me my old bent bow,
That I may shoot yon carrion crow;
Sing heigh ho, the carrion crow,
Fol de riddle, lol de riddle, hi ding do.
And shot his own sow quite through the heart;
Sing heigh ho, the carrion crow,
Fol de riddle, lol de riddle, hi ding do.
Wife, bring brandy in a spoon,
Fol de riddle, lol de riddle, hi ding
End of Project Gutenberg's The Tailor and the Crow, by L. Leslie Brooke
